There is church law that does state that only a priest, or some other *ordained* member of the clergy, can administer the sacrament of confession (also known as the sacrament of penance, or the sacrament of reconciliation)  Just like how only a priest can perform the sacrament of the Eucharist, or the sacrament of matrimony, in spite of there being no clear scriptural prohibition against lay people doing so, or any of the seven sacraments.  Specifically, cannon law 834 and 861.  If you think an ordained priest and a lay person are the same, fine, that's your belief.  But it is not a Catholic belief.  **And you have no right or authority, either legally or spiritually, to compel anyone else to violate their spiritual beliefs in order to better align with your own.**  You can disagree all you like... But the beauty of the 1st amendment is that your disagreement with the practices and beliefs of my faith does not grant you the authority to tell me I cannot practice my faith in accordance with its beliefs and practices.  Edit: and I'm going to leave it at that, because I have no interest in either a) converting you, or b) submitting my religious beliefs to your unsolicited scrutiny.  2nd edit: because I saw some of your other comments I feel the need to clarify something.    As a Catholics, we believe the gospels e.g. the Bible, were written by *humans* acting under divine inspiration.  This is opposed to, say the Muslim belief that the Quran is the literal word of God spoken by the prophet.  So when you keep saying *it's not biblical* nobody is disagreeing, but as Catholics we say that there is more to God's plan than the narrow interpretation of events recorded in the gospels by the mortally-flawed apostles, and thus the Church finds its purpose.  There are sects of Christianity who believe that all of God's plan is encompassed within the gospels and therefore there is no need for church law to interpret the scripture.  But, do not try to make Catholics agree with that statement, because that would be asking us to commit heresy.
Author: Shadeylark
